conclusion: Induced current is generated when there is a change in magnetic flux through the frame.
Induced current stops when the frame is completely inside or outside the magnetic field.
The frame has side length l, moves with velocity v, and the magnetic field width is d with l < d.
Induced current occurs when the leading edge enters and trailing edge exits the magnetic field.
Time for leading edge to enter magnetic field is t1 = l/v.
Induced current stops temporarily when the entire frame is inside the magnetic field.
Induced current resumes when the leading edge exits the magnetic field.
Time for trailing edge to exit magnetic field is t2 = l/v.
Total time for induced current is t_total = 2l/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is 2l/v.
